content: crocheted macramé plant hanger back to the 1970s size fits a standard tapered plant pot 5 or 6 across or smaller or try different shapes e g a bowl length of hanging chains c 11 fully adjustable materials any yarn you like with the appropriate hook - i would strongly recommend cotton as you don t want anything too stretchy my hanger including a nice thick tassel was made from one 20g ball of sirdar happy cotton dk 47 yards using a 4 5 mm hook if you want longer hanging chains of course you will need more working from the bottom up begin with a magic_ring or make 3 chain and join with a slip_stitch r1 chain-3 15 double_crochet counts as 16 double_crochet into magic_ring or chain loop pull magic_ring tightly closed if used close round with a slip_stitch into space between chain-3 and following double_crochet r2 chain-5 counts as 1 double_crochet + chain-2 *double_crochet in next st chain-2 repeat from * all around close with slip_stitch into chain-5 loop slip_stitch once more into same loop r3 chain-12 skip next 4 dcs and next 3 chain-2 spaces slip_stitch into next chain- 2 space repeat from beginning twice more chain-12 slip_stitch to base of first chain-12 loop r4 17 single_crochet around chain-12 loop slide along to fit neatly if necessary single_crochet in next slip_stitch repeat from beginning all around making last single_crochet into slip_stitch from previous round you need to begin the next round near the centre of the 17 single_crochet loop so slip_stitch into the first 8 sts r5 chain-2 decrease over next 2 sts pulling yarn through all three loops on hook to finish counts as dc3tog * chain-14 skip all intervening sts and dc3tog over centre 3 sts nos 8 9 and 10 of next 17 single_crochet loop repeat from * twice more chain-14 slip_stitch to top of first dc3tog r6 19 single_crochet around chain-14 loop single_crochet in top of dc3tog repeat from beginning all around finishing with a slip_stitch slip_stitch into first 10 sts to begin next round r7 chain-2 decrease over next 2 sts pulling yarn through all three loops on hook to finish counts as dc3tog * chain-16 skip all intervening sts and dc3tog over centre 3sts nos 9 10 and 11 of next 19 single_crochet loop repeat from * once more chain-16 slip_stitch to top of first dc3tog r8 11 single_crochet around chain-16 loop chain-75 11 single_crochet around rest of chain-16 loop double hanging chain made single_crochet in top of dc3tog repeat from beginning all around finishing with a slip_stitch you can make the chains shorter or longer of course according to requirements or the amount of yarn you can spare to finish if you can find beads with a big enough hole you can thread them down each hanging loop before these loops are joined together to decorate your plant hanger or you can stitch beads on as required a special tip if the hole in your beads isn t quite large
